content:
Diagnosis:	Advanced colon cancer with synchronous liver metastases, T4N2M1 (AJCC Stage IV), moderately differentiated adenocarcinoma, KRAS wild type, BRAF negative, MMR-proficient.

Treatment:	20.03.2021: Right hemicolectomy and liver resection (2 segments) - macroscopic complete resection, 3/23 lymph nodes positive.
		12 cycles adjuvant FOLFOX completed 01.2022 - mild neuropathy noted.
		07.2022: Disease progression with new hepatic lesions.
		07.2022-02.2023: 6 cycles FOLFIRI + bevacizumab, ceased due to grade 3 diarrhea and progression.
		03.2023: Transarterial chemoembolization (TACE) for hepatic metastases - partial response.
		06.2023-10.2023: Capecitabine monotherapy - mixed response with stable hepatic lesions but new peritoneal deposits.
		11.2023: Palliative RT to symptomatic pelvic mass 20Gy/5#.
		01.2024-12.2024: Encorafenib + cetuximab - partial response, continued fatigue, and worsening neuropathy.

Current Situation:	Completed last cycle of encorafenib + cetuximab in December 2024.

Symptoms:	Grade 2 neuropathy in hands and feet, fatigue, mild intermittent abdominal pain.

Examination:	Reduced grip strength bilaterally, mild peripheral edema, stable weight.

Investigations:	CT 15.12.2024 shows 50% reduction in liver lesions and stable peritoneal disease.

Plan:	Transition to surveillance protocol with 3-monthly CT and tumor markers.
	Continue physiotherapy for neuropathy and fatigue management.
	Follow-up with GI oncology clinic in 4 weeks to reassess symptoms and imaging.
	Letter copied to GP and palliative care team for ongoing support.
